instruction.en:
1) Connect the power supply.
2) Set the Z-Wave network main controller into inclusion mode (see Z-Wave network controller operating manual).
3) Press and hold the Z-button for 3 seconds to add the device in secure mode. The RGB LED indicator should blink fast in blue.
4) Smart Plug should be recognized and included into the Z-Wave network.

hint.en: Smart Plug keep detecting the load power, once the AC current exceeds 16.5A for more than 5s, smart plug's relay will turn off.

hint.en: Define how the Plug reacts after the power supply is back on.

label.en: Smart plug memorizes its state after a power failure (default)
Connected devices will be ON after a power failure
Connected devices will be OFF after a power failure

hint.en: Smart Plug can send notifications to association device (Group Lifeline) when state of smart plug’s load change.

label.en: Send Basic report only when state is not changed by Z-wave command (ie. manual button)

hint.en: After smart plug being included into a Z-Wave network, the RGB LED indicator will indicator the situation of load.

label.en: The smart plug will work in indicator mode (default)
The smart plug will work in indicator mode for 5 seconds after a load change

hint.en:
Power threshold to be interpreted, when the change value of load power exceeds the setting threshold, the smart plug will send meter report to associated device (Group Lifeline).
Default: 50, Range: 5 - 65535, 0 = disabled (W)

Power percentage threshold to be interpreted, when change value of the load power exceeds the setting threshold, the smart plug will send meter report to associated device (Group Lifeline).
Default: 10, Range: 0 - 100, 0 = disabled (%)

The interval of sending meter report(in term of wattage) to associated device (Group Lifeline). 
Default: 30, Range: 5 - 2678400, 0 = disabled (s)

The interval of sending meter report(in term of kWh) to associated device (Group Lifeline).
Default: 300, Range: 5 - 2678400, 0 = disabled (s)

The interval of sending meter report(in term of voltage) to associated device (Group Lifeline).
Default: 0 (disabled), Range: 5 - 2678400, 0 = disabled (s)

The interval of sending meter report(in term of current) to associated device (Group Lifeline).
Default: 0 (disabled), Range: 5 - 2678400, 0 = disabled (s)
